name: Head Cheese
description: Head Cheese combines the legendary strains 707 Headband and UK Cheese into a pungent and potent sativa-dominant hybrid. With a THC content pushing 25%, Head Cheese offers astonishing relief to symptoms like pain, migraines, inflammation, spasms, sleeplessness, and appetite loss. Bulky yellow-green buds carry the sharp cheese aroma and savory taste of its UK Cheese parent strain. Its effects are both relaxing and euphoric, a sensation that blissfully radiates throughout the mind and body.
descriptionPlain: Head Cheese combines the legendary strains 707 Headband and UK Cheese into a pungent and potent sativa-dominant hybrid. With a THC content pushing 25%, Head Cheese offers astonishing relief to symptoms like pain, migraines, inflammation, spasms, sleeplessness, and appetite loss. Bulky yellow-green buds carry the sharp cheese aroma and savory taste of its UK Cheese parent strain. Its effects are both relaxing and euphoric, a sensation that blissfully radiates throughout the mind and body.

highlightedReviews.text: ðŸ˜µðŸŽ† Head Cheese is everything you could ever want from a Sativa-dominant hybrid. The high is very distinct and is perfect for waking and baking or general daytime use. Personally I could smoke this anytime, as the mood lift is so prominent that this has quickly become one of my favorite strains! The smell is so disgustingly good, like a block of parmesan cheese and a pine cone had a stillborn baby. I would recommend this strain for people who want to fuel their creative endeavors or get actual work done and feel great while doing so. Myrcene: 7.4 mg/g, Ocimene: 3.4 mg/g and Linalool 1.0 mg/g.

This one certainly lives up to it's name because of it's remarkably unique taste and it's effects primarily because 707 is already a top 5 strain for me.  The flavor is incredibly different.  It tastes like parmesan cheese but it's not the same.  Like some exotic relative of parmesan.  The taste lingered and then it disappeared, only to reappear as I was snacking on chicken strips some time later.  Pretty cool.  This is a very euphoric and relaxing strain and I'd buy it again without hesitation.

articles.title: The 2015 DOPE Cup Winning Cannabis Strains, Concentrates, and Edibles
articles.author: Will Hyde
articles.text:
Over the 420 holiday weekend, DOPE Magazine celebrated their 4th annual DOPE Cup at 7-Point Studios in Seattle. The celebration was sponsored by Leafly and showcased some of the regionâ€™s best cannabis flower, concentrates, edibles, topicals, glass artists, and accessories. Even a last-minute venue change couldnâ€™t stop the stream of cannabis lovers from overflowing the state fair-themed event that came complete with infused cotton candy, a mechanical joint to ride, magicians, performers, artists, and more. Honestly, the only thing missing was a medicated cornÂ dog to combat my munchies.
As expected, the dab bar was the hive that everyone was buzzing around, with a variety of solvent and solventless concentrates to sample from some of the best extract artists in the area. The highlight had to be local artist Scott Deppeâ€™s crystal skull piece that sat at the X-Tracted bar and captured every passer-by with its intricate design and whopping 6-figure price tag. Those who werenâ€™t concentrated around the dab rigs were busy sampling edibles, entering raffles, and relaxing with a massage at one the topicalÂ company booths.

A judgeâ€™s pass to the event allowed visitors to join the action by sampling each of the strains entered into the People'sÂ Choice category of the Cup. For $99, the judgeâ€™s pass gave ticket-holders a half gram sample of all 10 anonymous strains and the opportunity to vote for their favorite. The mystery strains all had amazing flavors, ranging from sweet and tropical to earthy and piney, which made it all the more difficult to choose a favorite.

So, without further ado, here are the DOPE Cup winners!
Â 
Flower Winners

Â 
People's Choice Flower

Winner: CPC or Cotton Purple ChemÂ byÂ Hesperides Gardens (Strain #4)
Â 
Judges' Choice Flower

Winner: The SauceÂ byÂ ExoticGenetix (Strain #6)
Â 
Best Indica

Winner: Cascadia Kush by Hesperides Gardens
Runner Up: The White from Cannabis Club by Freak UV Nature
Â 
Best Sativa

Winner: Matanuska Thunder Fuck by TJ's Gardens
Runner Up: Head Cheese from Cali Connection
Â 
Best Hybrid

Winner: Peppermint Cookies by GoldLeaf Gardens
Runner Up: GSC (f.k.a Girl Scout Cookies) by Rain City Cannabis & Top Shelf
Â 
Highest THC

Winner: The White (29.9%) by Solstice
Runner Up: DT-13 (28.7%) by Patient 99 Care
Â 
Highest CBD

Winner: ACDC (18.05%) by Loaded Soda
Runner Up: ACDC x Charlotte's Web (17.02%) by B-EZ and Fweedom
Â 
Concentrate Winners

Â 
Best BHO â€“ THC
Winner: Marmalade (94.36%) from Platinum Extracts
Runner Up: Private Reserve OG (83.73%) from The BakerÃ©Ã©
Â 
Best BHO â€“ CBD

Winner: Sour Tsunami (83.7%) from Solstice by Refine
Runner Up: Sour Tsunami (74.08%) by Stoney Extracts
Â 
Best CO2 â€“ THC
Winner: Mixed Berry (48.56%, 110 ppm) by Evergreen Extracts
Runner Up: Death Star (69.09%, <10 ppm) by Happy Cats â€“ CO2 Organics
Â 
Best CO2 â€“ CBD

Winner: ACDC x Remedy (78% CBD, <10 ppm) by Loaded Soda â€“ CO2 Organics
Runner Up: Evergreen Extracts (42.81% CBD, <10 ppm)
Â 
Best Non-Solvent â€“ THC

Winner: Kimbo Kush (84.37%, dry sift) Cuban Tech from Exotic Genetics
Runner Up: Fire On the Mountain (82.68%) fromÂ NW Alchemy featuring Head Hunter
Â 
Best Non-Solvent â€“ CBD

Winner: Remedy (52.5% CBD, 3390 ppm ethanol) by Hesperides Gardens
Runner Up: ACDC (13.41% CBD bubble hash) Loaded Soda by CO2 Organics
Â 
Edible Winners

Â 
Best Edible â€“ Savory
Winner: Delux Nut Mix by Laurie and Marry Jane
Runner Up: Capitol Hill Peanut Butter
Â 
Best Edible â€“ Sweet
Winner: Dark Chocolate Fudge by Mad Monster
Runner Up: Almond Bites by Laurie and Marry Jane
Â 
Best Edible â€“ Drink
Winner: Loaded Soda Root Beer â€“ 104.85 mg THC
Runner Up: Sensi Sweet Tropical Punch â€“ 58.68 mg THC
Â 
Best Edible â€“ CBD
Winner: Vanilla Truffles from The BakereeÂ â€“ Cookie Fam Genetics
Runner Up: Slips by Oakor
Â 
Best Topical
Winner: Kush Cream Cherry Bomb â€“ 2.01 mg THC
Runner Up: Liberty Lotion High CBD â€“ 1.67 mg CBD

articles.title: It's Raining Sativas: LA Cannabis Cup Entries, Heirlooms, and Landraces Added to the Leafly Explorer
articles.author: Bailey Rahn
articles.text:
With now over 700 strains in the LeaflyÂ Explorer, we think itâ€™s time to celebrate with some invigorating and uplifting sativas. What would we do without theÂ strains that help us stay both medicated and productive throughout the day? How would we ever fight the temptations of couchlock and Xbox One to enjoy the outside world?
Weâ€™ve added some long-overdue classics as well as sativa entries for this weekendâ€™s LA Cannabis Cup. Seventeen of the West Coastâ€™s finest sativas will battle for the gold, as determined by a panel of luckyÂ judges. Stay tuned to find out which of these strains takes the crown â€” Leafly will be there providing live updates.
Have you come across any of these in your canna-quests? Let us know how it was in a review!
1. Dr. Grinspoon
Characteristics of Dr. Grinspoon:

100% sativa
Breeder: Barneyâ€™s Farm
Heirloom strain
Named after Harvard professor and cannabis activist Lester Grinspoon
Creative and introspective, with intense mental focus
Earthy with a honey aroma
13-14 week flowering period; small yields

2. Thai
Characteristics of Thai:

100% sativa
Landrace strain from Thailand
Parent to many Haze varieties
Intense but comfortable cerebral effects
Fruity, citrus aroma
Grows best in greenhouse gardens

3. Red Congolese
Characteristics of Red Congolese:

Mostly sativa
Derived from an African landrace
Magnolia Wellnessâ€™ sativa entry for 2014 LA Cannabis Cup
Elevating euphoria, focus, and mental clarity
Good for daytime treatment of nausea, cachexia, tension, or Alzheimerâ€™s

4. Candyland
Characteristics of Candyland:

75% sativa
Hybrid of Granddaddy Purple andÂ Bay Platinum Cookies
High End Deliveriesâ€™ sativa entry for 2014 LA Cannabis Cup
Uplifting and stimulating; conducive for social interaction and creative activities
Good for treating pain, muscle tension, and mood disorders

5. Head Cheese
Characteristics of Head Cheese:

60% sativa
Blunt Brothersâ€™ sativa entry for 2014 LA Cannabis Cup
Hybrid ofÂ Headband andÂ Cheese
Sharp cheese aroma
Relaxing and euphoric
Often chosen to treat pain, migraines, appetite loss, inflammation, spasms, and sleeplessness
High THC strain

6. ACDC
Characteristics of ACDC:

Mostly sativa
Booku Collectiveâ€™sÂ sativa entry for 2014 LA Cannabis Cup
A phenotype of the Cannatonic strain
High CBD with a THC:CBD ratio of 1:20; induces no psychoactive effects
Commonly used to treat pain, anxiety, epilepsy, multiple sclerosis, and the negative effects of chemotherapy

Find out more about the other LA Cannabis Cup sativa entries:
